headlines.description: Manchester United were denied a first away win of the season after they were held to a 1-1 draw against Southampton at St Mary's Stadium.
headlines.shortLinkText: Man United held to draw by 10-man Saints

headlines.description: Chelsea threw away a two-goal lead to draw 2-2 with newly promoted Sheffield United on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Chelsea waste lead in draw with Sheffield United

headlines.description: Aston Villa boss Dean Smith criticised the failure of VAR to overturn a decision to deny his side a late equaliser in the 1-0 defeat to Palace.
headlines.shortLinkText: Villa boss furious after late equaliser disallowed

headlines.description: Leicester City striker Jamie Vardy was involved in all three goals as Brendan Rodgers' side beat Bournemouth 3-1 in an end-to-end contest.
headlines.shortLinkText: Leicester's Vardy sinks Bournemouth with clinical display

events.name: Brighton & Hove Albion at Manchester City

headlines.description: A double from Sergio Aguero, a first of the season for Kevin De Bruyne and another from Bernardo Silva steered Manchester City to a 4-0 win.
headlines.shortLinkText: Aguero at the double as Man City hit four

headlines.description: After three successive Premier League defeats under manager Javi Gracia, Watford stopped the rot by hanging on to draw at Newcastle.
headlines.shortLinkText: Watford draw at Newcastle, end losing run

events.name: Norwich City at West Ham United

headlines.description: Sebastian Haller and Andriy Yarmolenko were on target as West Ham United picked up their second win of the season with a 2-0 victory over Norwich.
headlines.shortLinkText: Haller on target again as Hammers beat Norwich

headlines.description: Roberto Firmino had a goal and an assist as Liverpool eased past Burnley at Turf Moor Park on Saturday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Liverpool stay top with composed win at Burnley
